intro: Haumaniastrum kaessneri, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant produces yellow, dandelion-like flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seed heads that disperse seeds via the wind. Haumaniastrum kaessneri is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
